title: 113_hr675
content: The "Part-Time Worker Bill of Rights Act of 2013" extends employer health insurance coverage mandate to part-time employees. The "Part-Time Worker Bill of Rights Act of 2013" extends employer health insurance coverage mandate to part-time employees by amending the Internal Revenue Code to impose assessable payments on employers for each employee without health coverage. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to define the applicable payment amount for employees based on full-time or other status and average hours worked per week. Additionally, large employers offering coverage with employees eligible for premium tax credits or cost-sharing reductions are subject to amended provisions. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to define the applicable payment amount for employees based on full-time or other status and average hours worked per week. The code is further amended to prorate the payment for part-time employees. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to establish the applicable payment amount for employees based on their average hours of service per week. The overall limitation on tax for applicable large employers is also clarified. Section 4980H(c)(4) of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to change wording. The effective date for these amendments is after December 31, 2013. The Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993 is amended to eliminate the hours of service requirement for FMLA leave. An eligible employee is defined as someone who has been employed for at least 12 months by the employer requesting leave. This change will take effect one year after the enactment of the Act. Additionally, employees working less than full-time will have their participation, vesting, and accrual rules under pension plans addressed. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include new participation rules for employees who work between 500 and 1,000 hours per year. Completing 500 hours of service within a 12-month period will be treated as completing 1,000 hours of service. The amendments made by this Act apply to plan years beginning one year after enactment, with a special rule for collectively bargained plans.
